author: Jessica
title: Defining parameters
question:
When defining parameters for functions in a local, they could technically be named anything. 

example: 
…(local [(define taller? strawberry banana) …)]

however, what is the naming convention when we have more than one function in the local that operates on the top level data. Do we still use the same parameter? 

example: 
…(local [(define (fruit? x) (…))] 
             [(define (vegetable? x) (…))]

or should it be something like this: 
…(local [(define (fruit? m) (…))] 
             [(define (vegetable? n) (…))]

since we are passing the same data through the functions, I would believe it’s fine. However then we would be defining two of the same thing, which doesn’t sound right to me. 

Thanks
student_answer: parameter names really do not matter, although differentiating them might help you follow your program better and not get confused.
